reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports not later than 15 March 2007
summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions and statements on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), reaffirms its commitment to the country's sovereignty, territorial integrity, and political independence.

The Council extends the mandate and personnel strength of the United Nations Organization Mission in the DRC (MONUC) until 15 April 2007, as previously set out in resolutions 1565 (2004), 1592 (2005), 1596 (2005), 1621 (2005), 1635 (2005), and 1736 (2006).

The Council requests the Secretary-General to report on consultations with Congolese authorities by 15 March 2007 and submit recommendations on possible adjustments to MONUC's mandate and capacities.

The Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
